sections.title: Single Emission Point for Multiple Sources

content.text: When an emission point is shared with two or more sources, the subject source should be isolated. The non-subject sources should be shutdown during opacity observations if possible. If the non-subject sources cannot be shutdown, observe the emission point as normal and make a note that other sources were sharing the emission point.

media.caption: Two sources with a single emission point

sections.title: Multiple Emission Points for a Single Source

content.text: When there are multiple emission points for a single source, observe all of the emission points simultaneously and apply a corrective formula to each reading.

media.caption: One source with two emission points.
